conclusion: The graph shows the position of the particle as a function of time.
The x-axis represents time in seconds (t).
The y-axis represents displacement in meters (x).
The graph is a curve that starts at x = 10 m at t = 0 s and moves towards the negative direction.
The particle passes through the origin at t = 2 s, indicating that at t = 2 s, the particle is at x = 0 m.
The particle continues to move in the negative direction and reaches x = -10 m at t = 4 s.
Speed is the magnitude of the velocity.
Velocity is the first derivative of displacement with respect to time, i.e., v = dx/dt.
The slope of the displacement-time graph gives the velocity.

premise: The slope of the graph at any point is given by the change in displacement divided by the change in time.
conclusion: For the interval from t = 0 to t = 2 s, the slope is -5 m/s.
